title: High Dependency on Grants and Other Revenue
description: In 2019, grants and other revenue constituted 96.52% of Iraq's total revenue, indicating a significant reliance on external financial support.

title: Dominance of Fuel Exports
description: Fuel exports accounted for 99.99% of Iraq's merchandise exports in 2016, showcasing the country's heavy reliance on the oil sector.

title: Significant Electric Power Losses
description: In 2022, Iraq experienced electric power transmission and distribution losses amounting to 59.25% of output, highlighting inefficiencies in the energy sector.

title: Prevalence of Corruption in Business Interactions
description: As of 2022, 51.2% of firms in Iraq expected to give gifts during meetings with tax officials, indicating widespread corruption in business dealings.

title: Lowest Net Financial Flows from IMF Concessional Loans
description: In 2022, Iraq recorded a net financial flow of -$293 million from IMF concessional loans, indicating a significant outflow of funds.

title: Minimal Social Contributions as a Percentage of Revenue
description: In 2019, social contributions accounted for only 0.00045% of Iraq's total revenue, highlighting a minimal reliance on social contributions for revenue.

title: Lowest Female Employment to Population Ratio (Ages 15-24)
description: In 2021, only 2.58% of females aged 15-24 were employed in Iraq, reflecting a significant gender disparity in youth employment.

title: Lowest Medium and High-Tech Exports as a Percentage of Manufactured Exports
description: In 2022, medium and high-tech exports constituted only 0.037% of Iraq's manufactured exports, indicating a limited presence in the high-tech sector.

title: Minimal Female Participation in Firm Ownership
description: In 2022, only 3.8% of firms in Iraq had female participation in ownership, highlighting gender inequality in business leadership.

title: Lowest Food Exports as a Percentage of Merchandise Exports
description: In 2016, food exports made up a mere 0.0008% of Iraq's merchandise exports, indicating a negligible contribution of food products to export revenue.

title: Lowest Labor Force Participation Rate for Females
description: In 2021, only 10.77% of females aged 15+ participated in the labor force in Iraq, reflecting significant gender disparities in workforce participation.

title: Lowest Use of Banks for Financing Working Capital
description: In 2022, only 2.1% of firms in Iraq used banks to finance their working capital, indicating a low reliance on formal financial institutions for business operations.

title: Lowest Ratio of Female to Male Labor Force Participation Rate
description: In 2021, the ratio of female to male labor force participation in Iraq was 15.78%, highlighting a significant gender gap in workforce participation.
